body.header: Here are the notes taken by a student while she was listening to the lecture. Complete the notes by filling each gap with the correct word or phrase. In some gaps you may also need to supply 'a' or 'the'. When you have finished, listen to the lecture to check your answers.
body.section:
Astronomy – Lecture 1
is the whole of space – it consists of stars, , other celestial bodies, and dust and gas.A collection of millions/billions of stars is known as .Our collection of stars is referred to as – it's also called the Milky Way. is the star that the Earth orbits. It's also the only star we can see during the day.All are stars. is made up of the sun and all the objects that orbit it.These include the following: – lumps of rock orbiting the sun. Large numbers are found between Mars and Jupiter. – icy celestial objects with a tail of gas and dust. – pieces of metal and rock that make streaks of light in the night sky as they pass through the atmosphere. If they fall to Earth they are called . orbit planets. Mars has two and Jupiter sixteen.takes about a month to orbit the Earth.The Earth is a natural of the sun.
Click to listen
